pkgmetadata.longdescription: ZFSBootMenu is a Dracut module that intends to provide Linux distributions with an experience similar to FreeBSD's bootloader. By taking advantage of ZFS features, it allows a user to have multiple "boot environments" (with different distros, for example), manipulate snapshots before booting, and, for the adventurous user, even bootstrap a system installation via zfs recv.ls.
